section.name: Introduction
section.p: This page lists applications that run on top of the Loom application kernel. Each of these applications applications are at different stages of development and evolution. Some of the "applications" are thin wrappers around existing products that make them capable of being managed from within Loom. While others are applications are assembled from reusable Blocks.

section.name: Application list
section.p: James is an email and news server.
LDAPd is a pure Java LDAP v3 protocol, RFC 2251 compliant server. It's architecture is based on Matt Welsh's Staged Event Driven Architecture (SEDA).
Ancient and insecure (over TCP/IP) protocol for having shell access to a computer.
FTPServer is a solid FTPServer built on top of Loom.

Hendrik Schreiber has an excellent web server that is servlet capable. It comes with a block for use within Loom. As a demo, it is possible to build a SAR file to see the default webapp of Jo! running under Loom control. Jo! is Open-Source (LGPL license).
Alexis Agahi and Vinaysahil Chandran have migrated JabaServer (an open-source Java implementation of Jabber) to be Loom dependant. JabberServer is under a BSD license.
This is a desktop GUI that sits on Loom.
A JMS implementation hosted at SourceForge.
A wrapper that allows the Hypersonic SQL engine to be served from inside Loom.
